bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Pages H7152-H7153]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. McDERMOTT:H.R. 3515.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Section 8--To make all Laws which shall benecessary and proper for carrying into Execution theforegoing powers,[[Page H7153]]and all other powers vested by this Constitution in theGovernment of the United States

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity.
Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1681)

summary.text: Increased Age Limit for Post-9/11 Education Assistance Dependents Act - Increases from 26 to 29 years old the age after which a child may not use transferred educational assistance for service in the Armed Forces commencing on or after September 11, 2001.

bill.title: Increased Age Limit for Post-9/11 Education Assistance Dependents Act

item.title: Increased Age Limit for Post-9/11 Education Assistance Dependents Act
To amend title 38, United States Code, to increase the age limit for children using transferred Post-9/11 Educational Assistance.
Increased Age Limit for Post-9/11 Education Assistance Dependents Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
